result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Elroy F Raasch was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall comply with an AODA and comply with the Driver Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall attend the next OWI Victim Impact Panel scheduled for January 7, 2016 at the discretion of his probation agent or any other equivalent program.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or high school diploma at the discretion of probation.
 Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin immediately. The jail sentence may be served with good time.  

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Consecutive to: Jail sentence is consecutive to any other jail sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elroy F Raasch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Elroy F Raasch in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Elroy F Raasch in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waiving his right to a preliminary hearing and is ready for sentencing today in this.  Court questions defendant regarding waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing was filed with the court. Court finds defendant freely and intelligently waives his preliminary hearing.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of information.  Plea of guilty to count 1.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses count 2.   Court orders withheld sentence probation for three years; $3,214.00 fine; 6 months county jail with huber and good time consecutive to any other sentence jail may be served in any other county at no cost to Taylor County; 36 month revocation of DL; IID for a minimum of one year: $41.00 reimbursement of blood draw; AODA; DNA sample and surcharge; OWI victim impact panel at the discretion of probation when defendant shall attend the panel or any other equivalent program.  Defendant shall obtain his GED, HSED or high school diploma at agent's discretion.  - rt
to Elroy F Raasch - Notice of Hearing - no forwarding address
